Module org.example
Package org.example.application.customer

Class CustomerDaoImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wgu.cristianreyes.application.customer.CustomerDaoImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerDao
    public final class CustomerDaoImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerDao
    Concrete implementation of the CustomerDao interface. Handles database access of Customer objects.

      • CustomerDaoImpl

        public CustomerDaoImpl​(ConnectionPool dataSource)
                throws ConnectionPool.ConnectionsUnavailableException
        Constructor initializes dataSource object to the given ConnectionPool.
        Parameters:
        dataSource - ConnectionPool from which database connections can be retrieved.
        Throws:
        ConnectionPool.ConnectionsUnavailableException - If the connection pool object passed as an argument is null (usually from a misconfigured ConnectionPool initialization) this exception is thrown.

        public boolean hasNoAppointments​(int customerId)
        Retrieves the appointments for a customer with the given customerId and returns a boolean indicating whether or not the result is empty
        Parameters:
        customerId - the customer ID of customer being queried for.
        Returns:
        true if customer has no appointments in database, false otherwise.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        updatedCustomer - a Customer object representing the customer to be updated. All fields in the database will be updated to match the Customer object's fields.
